meanings.definition: Capable of being understood or appreciated.
meanings.sent1: The concept was so graspable that even young children could comprehend it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the lesson in a way that made it easily graspable for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The idea was so graspable that it made the whole class burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was as clear and graspable as a crystal-clear lake on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The graspable nature of the story made it unforgettable for all who heard it.

meanings.definition: Able to be physically held or touched.
meanings.sent1: The toy was designed to be easily graspable by small hands.
meanings.sent2: The handle of the mug was made graspable for a comfortable hold.
meanings.sent3: The slippery fish proved to be quite graspable for the determined fisherman.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a graspable lifeline in the stormy sea of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The graspable texture of the fabric made it irresistible to touch.
